problem: What is the sum of the first ten positive multiples of $13$?
solution:
The first ten positive multiples of 13 are 13, $13 \cdot 2$, $\dots$, $13 \cdot 10$, so we want to find the sum $13 + 13 \cdot 2 + \dots + 13 \cdot 10 = 13 \cdot (1 + 2 + \dots + 10)$.

For all $n$, $1 + 2 + \dots + n = n(n + 1)/2$, so $13 \cdot (1 + 2 + \dots + 10) = 13 \cdot 10 \cdot 11/2 = \boxed{715}$.
chatgpt_solution: The first ten positive multiples of $13$ are $13$, $2 \cdot 13$, $3 \cdot 13$, $\ldots$, $10 \cdot 13$. This is an arithmetic sequence with first term $13$, common difference $13$, and last term $10 \cdot 13 = 130$. Thus, the sum of this arithmetic sequence is equal to $$\frac{13 + 130}{2} \cdot 10 = \frac{143}{2} \cdot 10 = \boxed{715}.$$
